content.description: The crux is finding good feet.
content.protection: A pad for the rock at the base.
content.location: Tiger Toss is the rightmost problem on the gently overhanging orange and yellow wall. Start with your left hand on a nice crimp about chest level with your right hand in the shallow, two finger pocket. Find the feet, toss for the rail, get high feet, and from the rail toss to the top. Exit out right.

content.description: Start with your left hand on a great crimp and your right hand in the shallow, two finger pocket. Move up to the mono with your right hand. High feet will allow you nab the horizontal seam with your left hand and then your right hand before committing to the exit.
content.location:
It is the leftmost problem on the Claw Wall - left of

Kitty Fingers

.

content.description: Skinny ascends a left-facing flake system leading up to a mellow mantel.
content.location: Walk down the corridor with the west to your right. Halfway down on the right is a left-facing flake system. Climb this. It's fragile, so pull lightly.

content.description: Start with both of your hands on the good rail, move up the face using the two dishes to a right hand crimp, bring up your feet, bump out left to a good crimp hidden in the high rail bring the feet up to the dishes, and throw for the lip.
content.location: This is on the gently overhanging orange and yellow wall at the base of the trail into the Cat's Den.

content.description: The crux is finding the feet after making the move over the gash - small, thin incuts lead you to a fun mantel.
content.location: Start on the west side of the corridor approximately 10' from the opening. There's a gash that runs about 6' up and down half the length of the corridor.

content.description: Tread lightly up the tall face. This lies just left of the corridor and 15â€™ from the cliff edge.
content.protection: A pad and a spotter might easy the nerves.
content.location: From the trail to the base of the Cat's Den, head left (if facing the cliff) till you see the corridor, and then look left to the tall, cobblestone wall.

content.description: Climb the corner - it climbs left or right of the corner and has a fun, weird, mantel exit.
content.location: It is left of the entrance trail.

pathTokens: Denver Metropolitan Area Bouldering and Buildering
